contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim is oppressed, crushed in judgment,","poem":1},{"text":"for he is determined to follow worthless idols.","poem":2},{"noteId":32}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Ephraim is oppressed, crushed in judgment, for he is determined to follow worthless idols.

contentJson: [{"text":"So I am like a moth to Ephraim,","poem":1},{"text":"and like decay to the house of Judah.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So I am like a moth to Ephraim, and like decay to the house of Judah.

contentJson: [{"text":"When Ephraim saw his sickness","poem":1},{"text":"and Judah his wound,","poem":2},{"text":"then Ephraim turned to Assyria","poem":1},{"text":"and sent to the great king.","poem":2},{"noteId":33},{"text":"But he cannot cure you","poem":1},{"text":"or heal your wound.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When Ephraim saw his sickness and Judah his wound, then Ephraim turned to Assyria and sent to the great king. But he cannot cure you or heal your wound.

contentJson: [{"text":"For I am like a lion to Ephraim","poem":1},{"text":"and like a young lion to the house of Judah.","poem":2},{"text":"I, even I, will tear them to pieces","poem":1},{"text":"and then go away.","poem":2},{"text":"I will carry them off","poem":1},{"text":"where no one can rescue them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For I am like a lion to Ephraim and like a young lion to the house of Judah. I, even I, will tear them to pieces and then go away. I will carry them off where no one can rescue them.

contentJson: [{"text":"Then I will return to My place","poem":1},{"text":"until they admit their guilt and seek My face;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"in their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Then I will return to My place until they admit their guilt and seek My face; 
in their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.”

contentJson: [{"text":"Come, let us return to the LORD.","poem":1},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"For He has torn us to pieces,","poem":1},{"text":"but He will heal us;","poem":2},{"text":"He has wounded us,","poem":1},{"text":"but He will bind up our wounds.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Come, let us return to the LORD. 
For He has torn us to pieces, but He will heal us; He has wounded us, but He will bind up our wounds.

contentJson: [{"text":"After two days He will revive us;","poem":1},{"text":"on the third day He will raise us up,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"that we may live in His presence.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
After two days He will revive us; on the third day He will raise us up, 
that we may live in His presence.

contentJson: [{"text":"So let us know—","poem":1},{"text":"let us press on to know the LORD.","poem":2},{"text":"As surely as the sun rises,","poem":1},{"text":"He will appear;","poem":2},{"text":"He will come to us like the rain,","poem":1},{"text":"like the spring showers that water the earth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So let us know— let us press on to know the LORD. As surely as the sun rises, He will appear; He will come to us like the rain, like the spring showers that water the earth.

contentJson: [{"text":"What shall I do with you, O Ephraim","poem":1},{"noteId":34},{"text":"?","poem":1},{"text":"What shall I do with you, O Judah?","poem":2},{"text":"For your loyalty is like a morning mist,","poem":1},{"text":"like the early dew that vanishes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What shall I do with you, O Ephraim ? What shall I do with you, O Judah? For your loyalty is like a morning mist, like the early dew that vanishes.

contentJson: [{"text":"Therefore I have hewn them by the prophets;","poem":1},{"text":"I have slain them by the words of My mouth,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and My judgments go forth like lightning.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Therefore I have hewn them by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of My mouth, 
and My judgments go forth like lightning.

contentJson: [{"text":"For I desire mercy, not sacrifice,","poem":1},{"noteId":35},{"text":"and the knowledge of God","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"rather than burnt offerings.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
For I desire mercy, not sacrifice, and the knowledge of God 
rather than burnt offerings.

contentJson: [{"text":"But they, like Adam, have transgressed","poem":1},{"noteId":36},{"text":"the covenant;","poem":1},{"text":"there they were unfaithful to Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But they, like Adam, have transgressed the covenant; there they were unfaithful to Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Gilead is a city of evildoers,","poem":1},{"text":"tracked with footprints of blood.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Gilead is a city of evildoers, tracked with footprints of blood.

contentJson: [{"text":"Like raiders who lie in ambush,","poem":1},{"text":"so does a band of priests;","poem":2},{"text":"they murder on the way to Shechem;","poem":1},{"text":"surely they have committed atrocities.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Like raiders who lie in ambush, so does a band of priests; they murder on the way to Shechem; surely they have committed atrocities.

contentJson: [{"text":"In the house of Israel","poem":1},{"text":"I have seen a horrible thing:","poem":2},{"text":"Ephraim practices prostitution there,","poem":1},{"text":"and Israel is defiled.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing: Ephraim practices prostitution there, and Israel is defiled.

contentJson: [{"text":"Also for you, O Judah,","poem":1},{"text":"a harvest is appointed,","poem":2},{"text":"when I restore","poem":1},{"text":"My people from captivity.","poem":2},{"noteId":37}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Also for you, O Judah, a harvest is appointed, when I restore My people from captivity.

contentJson: [{"text":"When I heal Israel,","poem":1},{"text":"the iniquity of Ephraim","poem":2},{"noteId":38},{"text":"will be exposed,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"as well as the crimes of Samaria.","poem":2},{"text":"For they practice deceit and thieves break in;","poem":1},{"text":"bandits raid in the streets.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
When I heal Israel, the iniquity of Ephraim will be exposed, 
as well as the crimes of Samaria. For they practice deceit and thieves break in; bandits raid in the streets.

contentJson: [{"text":"But they fail to consider in their hearts","poem":1},{"text":"that I remember all their evil.","poem":2},{"text":"Now their deeds are all around them;","poem":1},{"text":"they are before My face.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But they fail to consider in their hearts that I remember all their evil. Now their deeds are all around them; they are before My face.

contentJson: [{"text":"They delight the king with their evil,","poem":1},{"text":"and the princes with their lies.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They delight the king with their evil, and the princes with their lies.

contentJson: [{"text":"They are all adulterers,","poem":1},{"text":"like an oven heated by a baker","poem":2},{"text":"who needs not stoke the fire","poem":1},{"text":"from the kneading to the rising of the dough.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They are all adulterers, like an oven heated by a baker who needs not stoke the fire from the kneading to the rising of the dough.

contentJson: [{"text":"The princes are inflamed with wine","poem":1},{"text":"on the day of our king;","poem":2},{"text":"so he joins hands","poem":1},{"text":"with those who mock him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The princes are inflamed with wine on the day of our king; so he joins hands with those who mock him.

contentJson: [{"text":"For they prepare their heart like an oven","poem":1},{"text":"while they lie in wait;","poem":2},{"text":"all night their anger smolders;","poem":1},{"noteId":39},{"text":"in the morning it blazes like a flaming fire.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For they prepare their heart like an oven while they lie in wait; all night their anger smolders; in the morning it blazes like a flaming fire.

contentJson: [{"text":"All of them are hot as an oven,","poem":1},{"text":"and they devour their rulers.","poem":2},{"text":"All their kings fall;","poem":1},{"text":"not one of them calls upon Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: All of them are hot as an oven, and they devour their rulers. All their kings fall; not one of them calls upon Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim mixes with the nations;","poem":1},{"text":"Ephraim is an unturned cake.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Ephraim mixes with the nations; Ephraim is an unturned cake.

contentJson: [{"text":"Foreigners consume his strength,","poem":1},{"text":"but he does not notice.","poem":2},{"text":"Even his hair is streaked with gray,","poem":1},{"text":"but he does not know.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Foreigners consume his strength, but he does not notice. Even his hair is streaked with gray, but he does not know.

contentJson: [{"text":"Israel’s arrogance testifies against them,","poem":1},{"text":"yet they do not return to the LORD their God;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"despite all this, they do not seek Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Israel’s arrogance testifies against them, yet they do not return to the LORD their God; 
despite all this, they do not seek Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"So Ephraim has become like a silly, senseless dove—","poem":1},{"text":"calling out to Egypt, then turning to Assyria.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So Ephraim has become like a silly, senseless dove— calling out to Egypt, then turning to Assyria.

contentJson: [{"text":"As they go, I will spread My net over them;","poem":1},{"text":"I will bring them down like birds of the air.","poem":2},{"text":"I will chastise them","poem":1},{"text":"when I hear them flocking together.","poem":2},{"noteId":40}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: As they go, I will spread My net over them; I will bring them down like birds of the air. I will chastise them when I hear them flocking together.

contentJson: [{"text":"Woe to them, for they have strayed from Me!","poem":1},{"text":"Destruction to them, for they have rebelled against Me!","poem":2},{"text":"Though I would redeem them,","poem":1},{"text":"they speak lies against Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Woe to them, for they have strayed from Me! Destruction to them, for they have rebelled against Me! Though I would redeem them, they speak lies against Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"They do not cry out to Me from their hearts","poem":1},{"text":"when they wail upon their beds.","poem":2},{"text":"They slash themselves","poem":1},{"noteId":41},{"text":"for grain and new wine,","poem":1},{"text":"but turn away from Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They do not cry out to Me from their hearts when they wail upon their beds. They slash themselves for grain and new wine, but turn away from Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Although I trained and strengthened their arms,","poem":1},{"text":"they plot evil against Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Although I trained and strengthened their arms, they plot evil against Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"They turn, but not to the Most High;","poem":1},{"text":"they are like a faulty bow.","poem":2},{"text":"Their leaders will fall by the sword","poem":1},{"text":"for the cursing of their tongue;","poem":2},{"text":"for this they will be ridiculed","poem":1},{"text":"in the land of Egypt.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They turn, but not to the Most High; they are like a faulty bow. Their leaders will fall by the sword for the cursing of their tongue; for this they will be ridiculed in the land of Egypt.

contentJson: [{"text":"Put the ram’s horn to your lips!","poem":1},{"text":"An eagle looms over the house of the LORD,","poem":2},{"text":"because the people have transgressed My covenant","poem":1},{"text":"and rebelled against My law.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Put the ram’s horn to your lips! An eagle looms over the house of the LORD, because the people have transgressed My covenant and rebelled against My law.

contentJson: [{"text":"Israel cries out to Me,","poem":1},{"text":"“O our God, we know You!”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Israel cries out to Me, “O our God, we know You!”

contentJson: [{"text":"But Israel has rejected good;","poem":1},{"text":"an enemy will pursue him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But Israel has rejected good; an enemy will pursue him.

contentJson: [{"text":"They set up kings, but not by Me.","poem":1},{"text":"They make princes, but without My approval.","poem":2},{"text":"With their silver and gold they make themselves idols,","poem":1},{"text":"to their own destruction.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They set up kings, but not by Me. They make princes, but without My approval. With their silver and gold they make themselves idols, to their own destruction.

contentJson: [{"text":"He has rejected your calf,","poem":1},{"noteId":42},{"text":"O Samaria.","poem":1},{"text":"My anger burns against them.","poem":2},{"text":"How long will they be","poem":1},{"text":"incapable of innocence?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He has rejected your calf, O Samaria. My anger burns against them. How long will they be incapable of innocence?

contentJson: [{"text":"For this thing is from Israel—","poem":1},{"text":"a craftsman made it, and it is not God.","poem":2},{"text":"It will be broken to pieces,","poem":1},{"text":"that calf of Samaria.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For this thing is from Israel— a craftsman made it, and it is not God. It will be broken to pieces, that calf of Samaria.

contentJson: [{"text":"For they sow the wind,","poem":1},{"text":"and they shall reap the whirlwind.","poem":2},{"text":"There is no standing grain;","poem":1},{"text":"what sprouts fails to yield flour.","poem":2},{"text":"Even if it should produce,","poem":1},{"text":"the foreigners would swallow it up.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For they sow the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind. There is no standing grain; what sprouts fails to yield flour. Even if it should produce, the foreigners would swallow it up.

contentJson: [{"text":"Israel is swallowed up!","poem":1},{"text":"Now they are among the nations","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"like a worthless vessel.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Israel is swallowed up! Now they are among the nations 
like a worthless vessel.

contentJson: [{"text":"For they have gone up to Assyria","poem":1},{"text":"like a wild donkey on its own.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Ephraim","poem":2},{"noteId":43},{"text":"has hired lovers.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
For they have gone up to Assyria like a wild donkey on its own. 
Ephraim has hired lovers.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though they hire allies among the nations,","poem":1},{"text":"I will now round them up,","poem":2},{"text":"and they will begin to diminish","poem":1},{"text":"under the oppression of the king of princes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though they hire allies among the nations, I will now round them up, and they will begin to diminish under the oppression of the king of princes.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though Ephraim multiplied the altars for sin,","poem":1},{"text":"they became his altars for sinning.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though Ephraim multiplied the altars for sin, they became his altars for sinning.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though I wrote for them the great things of My law,","poem":1},{"text":"they regarded them as something strange.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though I wrote for them the great things of My law, they regarded them as something strange.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though they offer sacrifices as gifts to Me,","poem":1},{"text":"and though they eat the meat,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"the LORD does not accept them.","poem":2},{"text":"Now He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins:","poem":1},{"text":"They will return to Egypt.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Though they offer sacrifices as gifts to Me, and though they eat the meat, 
the LORD does not accept them. Now He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins: They will return to Egypt.

contentJson: [{"text":"Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces;","poem":1},{"text":"Judah has multiplied its fortified cities.","poem":2},{"text":"But I will send fire upon their cities,","poem":1},{"text":"and it will consume their citadels.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; Judah has multiplied its fortified cities. But I will send fire upon their cities, and it will consume their citadels.

contentJson: [{"text":"Do not rejoice, O Israel,","poem":1},{"text":"with exultation like the nations,","poem":2},{"text":"for you have played the harlot against your God;","poem":1},{"text":"you have made love for hire on every threshing floor.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Do not rejoice, O Israel, with exultation like the nations, for you have played the harlot against your God; you have made love for hire on every threshing floor.

contentJson: [{"text":"The threshing floor and winepress will not feed them,","poem":1},{"text":"and the new wine will fail them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The threshing floor and winepress will not feed them, and the new wine will fail them.

contentJson: [{"text":"They will not remain","poem":1},{"text":"in the land of the LORD;","poem":2},{"text":"Ephraim","poem":1},{"noteId":44},{"text":"will return to Egypt","poem":1},{"text":"and eat unclean food in Assyria.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They will not remain in the land of the LORD; Ephraim will return to Egypt and eat unclean food in Assyria.

contentJson: [{"text":"They will not pour out wine offerings to the LORD,","poem":1},{"text":"and their sacrifices will not please Him,","poem":2},{"text":"but will be to them like the bread of mourners;","poem":1},{"text":"all who eat will be defiled.","poem":2},{"text":"For their bread will be for themselves;","poem":1},{"text":"it will not enter the house of the LORD.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They will not pour out wine offerings to the LORD, and their sacrifices will not please Him, but will be to them like the bread of mourners; all who eat will be defiled. For their bread will be for themselves; it will not enter the house of the LORD.

contentJson: [{"text":"What will you do on the appointed day,","poem":1},{"text":"on the day of the LORD’s feast?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What will you do on the appointed day, on the day of the LORD’s feast?

contentJson: [{"text":"For even if they flee destruction,","poem":1},{"text":"Egypt will gather them","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and Memphis will bury them.","poem":2},{"text":"Their precious silver will be taken over by thistles,","poem":1},{"text":"and thorns will overrun their tents.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
For even if they flee destruction, Egypt will gather them 
and Memphis will bury them. Their precious silver will be taken over by thistles, and thorns will overrun their tents.

contentJson: [{"text":"The days of punishment have come;","poem":1},{"text":"the days of retribution have arrived—","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"let Israel know it.","poem":2},{"text":"The prophet is called a fool,","poem":1},{"text":"and the inspired man insane,","poem":2},{"text":"because of the greatness","poem":1},{"text":"of your iniquity and hostility.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The days of punishment have come; the days of retribution have arrived— 
let Israel know it. The prophet is called a fool, and the inspired man insane, because of the greatness of your iniquity and hostility.

contentJson: [{"text":"The prophet is Ephraim’s watchman,","poem":1},{"text":"along with my God,","poem":2},{"noteId":45},{"text":"yet the snare of the fowler lies on all his paths.","poem":1},{"text":"Hostility is in the house of his God!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The prophet is Ephraim’s watchman, along with my God, yet the snare of the fowler lies on all his paths. Hostility is in the house of his God!

contentJson: [{"text":"They have deeply corrupted themselves","poem":1},{"text":"as in the days of Gibeah;","poem":2},{"text":"He will remember their guilt;","poem":1},{"text":"He will punish their sins.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They have deeply corrupted themselves as in the days of Gibeah; He will remember their guilt; He will punish their sins.

contentJson: [{"text":"I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness.","poem":1},{"text":"I saw your fathers as the firstfruits","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"of the fig tree in its first season.","poem":2},{"text":"But they went to Baal-peor,","poem":1},{"text":"and consecrated themselves to Shame;","poem":2},{"text":"so they became as detestable","poem":1},{"text":"as the thing they loved.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness. I saw your fathers as the firstfruits 
of the fig tree in its first season. But they went to Baal-peor, and consecrated themselves to Shame; so they became as detestable as the thing they loved.

contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim’s glory will fly away like a bird,","poem":1},{"text":"with no birth, no pregnancy, and no conception.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Ephraim’s glory will fly away like a bird, with no birth, no pregnancy, and no conception.

contentJson: [{"text":"Even if they raise their children,","poem":1},{"text":"I will bereave them of each one.","poem":2},{"text":"Yes, woe be to them","poem":1},{"text":"when I turn away from them!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Even if they raise their children, I will bereave them of each one. Yes, woe be to them when I turn away from them!

contentJson: [{"text":"I have seen Ephraim, like Tyre,","poem":1},{"text":"planted in a meadow.","poem":2},{"text":"But Ephraim will bring out","poem":1},{"text":"his children for slaughter.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I have seen Ephraim, like Tyre, planted in a meadow. But Ephraim will bring out his children for slaughter.

contentJson: [{"text":"Give them, O LORD—","poem":1},{"text":"what will You give?","poem":2},{"text":"Give them wombs that miscarry","poem":1},{"text":"and breasts that dry up!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Give them, O LORD— what will You give? Give them wombs that miscarry and breasts that dry up!

contentJson: [{"text":"All their evil appears at Gilgal,","poem":1},{"text":"for there I hated them.","poem":2},{"text":"I will drive them from My house","poem":1},{"text":"for the wickedness of their deeds.","poem":2},{"text":"I will no longer love them;","poem":1},{"text":"all their leaders are rebellious.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: All their evil appears at Gilgal, for there I hated them. I will drive them from My house for the wickedness of their deeds. I will no longer love them; all their leaders are rebellious.

contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim is struck down;","poem":1},{"text":"their root is withered;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"they cannot bear fruit.","poem":2},{"text":"Even if they bear children,","poem":1},{"text":"I will slay the darlings of their wombs.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Ephraim is struck down; their root is withered; 
they cannot bear fruit. Even if they bear children, I will slay the darlings of their wombs.

contentJson: [{"text":"My God will reject them","poem":1},{"text":"because they have not obeyed Him;","poem":2},{"text":"and they shall be wanderers","poem":1},{"text":"among the nations.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My God will reject them because they have not obeyed Him; and they shall be wanderers among the nations.

contentJson: [{"text":"Israel was a luxuriant vine,","poem":1},{"text":"yielding fruit for himself.","poem":2},{"text":"The more his fruit increased,","poem":1},{"text":"the more he increased the altars.","poem":2},{"text":"The better his land produced,","poem":1},{"text":"the better he made the sacred pillars.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Israel was a luxuriant vine, yielding fruit for himself. The more his fruit increased, the more he increased the altars. The better his land produced, the better he made the sacred pillars.

contentJson: [{"text":"Their hearts are devious;","poem":1},{"text":"now they must bear their guilt.","poem":2},{"text":"The LORD will break down their altars","poem":1},{"text":"and demolish their sacred pillars.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Their hearts are devious; now they must bear their guilt. The LORD will break down their altars and demolish their sacred pillars.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely now they will say,","poem":1},{"text":"“We have no king,","poem":2},{"text":"for we do not revere the LORD.","poem":1},{"text":"What can a king do for us?”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely now they will say, “We have no king, for we do not revere the LORD. What can a king do for us?”

contentJson: [{"text":"They speak mere words;","poem":1},{"text":"with false oaths they make covenants.","poem":2},{"text":"So judgment springs up","poem":1},{"text":"like poisonous weeds in the furrows of a field.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They speak mere words; with false oaths they make covenants. So judgment springs up like poisonous weeds in the furrows of a field.

contentJson: [{"text":"The people of Samaria will fear","poem":1},{"text":"for the calf of Beth-aven.","poem":2},{"noteId":46},{"text":"Indeed, its people will mourn","poem":1},{"text":"with its idolatrous priests—","poem":2},{"text":"those who rejoiced in its glory—","poem":1},{"text":"for it has been taken from them into exile.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The people of Samaria will fear for the calf of Beth-aven. Indeed, its people will mourn with its idolatrous priests— those who rejoiced in its glory— for it has been taken from them into exile.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yes, it will be carried to Assyria","poem":1},{"text":"as tribute to the great king.","poem":2},{"noteId":47},{"text":"Ephraim","poem":1},{"noteId":48},{"text":"will be seized with shame;","poem":1},{"text":"Israel will be ashamed of its wooden idols.","poem":2},{"noteId":49}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yes, it will be carried to Assyria as tribute to the great king. Ephraim will be seized with shame; Israel will be ashamed of its wooden idols.

contentJson: [{"text":"Samaria will be carried off with her king","poem":1},{"text":"like a twig on the surface of the water.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Samaria will be carried off with her king like a twig on the surface of the water.

contentJson: [{"text":"The high places of Aven","poem":1},{"noteId":50},{"text":"will be destroyed—","poem":1},{"text":"it is the sin of Israel;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"thorns and thistles will overgrow their altars.","poem":2},{"text":"Then they will say to the mountains, “Cover us!”","poem":1},{"text":"and to the hills, “Fall on us!”","poem":2},{"noteId":51}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The high places of Aven will be destroyed— it is the sin of Israel; 
thorns and thistles will overgrow their altars. Then they will say to the mountains, “Cover us!” and to the hills, “Fall on us!”

contentJson: [{"text":"Since the days of Gibeah you have sinned, O Israel,","poem":1},{"text":"and there you have remained.","poem":2},{"text":"Did not the battle in Gibeah","poem":1},{"text":"overtake the sons of iniquity?","poem":2},{"noteId":52}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Since the days of Gibeah you have sinned, O Israel, and there you have remained. Did not the battle in Gibeah overtake the sons of iniquity?

contentJson: [{"text":"I will chasten them when I please;","poem":1},{"text":"nations will be gathered against them","poem":2},{"text":"to put them in bondage","poem":1},{"text":"for their double transgression.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I will chasten them when I please; nations will be gathered against them to put them in bondage for their double transgression.

contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim is a well-trained heifer that loves to thresh;","poem":1},{"text":"but I will place a yoke on her fair neck.","poem":2},{"text":"I will harness Ephraim, Judah will plow,","poem":1},{"text":"and Jacob will break the hard ground.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Ephraim is a well-trained heifer that loves to thresh; but I will place a yoke on her fair neck. I will harness Ephraim, Judah will plow, and Jacob will break the hard ground.

contentJson: [{"text":"Sow for yourselves righteousness","poem":1},{"text":"and reap the fruit of loving devotion;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"break up your unplowed ground.","poem":2},{"text":"For it is time to seek the LORD","poem":1},{"text":"until He comes and sends righteousness","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"upon you like rain.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible

contentJson: [{"text":"You have plowed wickedness and reaped injustice;","poem":1},{"text":"you have eaten the fruit of lies.","poem":2},{"text":"Because you have trusted in your own way","poem":1},{"text":"and in the multitude of your mighty men,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You have plowed wickedness and reaped injustice; you have eaten the fruit of lies. Because you have trusted in your own way and in the multitude of your mighty men,

contentJson: [{"text":"the roar of battle will rise against your people,","poem":1},{"text":"so that all your fortresses will be demolished","poem":2},{"text":"as Shalman devastated Beth-arbel","poem":1},{"text":"in the day of battle,","poem":2},{"text":"when mothers were dashed to pieces","poem":1},{"text":"along with their children.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: the roar of battle will rise against your people, so that all your fortresses will be demolished as Shalman devastated Beth-arbel in the day of battle, when mothers were dashed to pieces along with their children.

contentJson: [{"text":"Thus it will be done to you, O Bethel,","poem":1},{"text":"because of your great wickedness.","poem":2},{"text":"When the day dawns,","poem":1},{"text":"the king of Israel will be utterly cut off.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Thus it will be done to you, O Bethel, because of your great wickedness. When the day dawns, the king of Israel will be utterly cut off.

contentJson: [{"text":"When Israel was a child, I loved him,","poem":1},{"text":"and out of Egypt I called My son.","poem":2},{"noteId":53}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When Israel was a child, I loved him, and out of Egypt I called My son.

contentJson: [{"text":"But the more I called Israel,","poem":1},{"text":"the farther they departed from Me.","poem":2},{"noteId":54},{"text":"They sacrificed to the Baals","poem":1},{"text":"and burned incense to carved images.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But the more I called Israel, the farther they departed from Me. They sacrificed to the Baals and burned incense to carved images.

contentJson: [{"text":"It was I who taught Ephraim","poem":1},{"noteId":55},{"text":"to walk,","poem":1},{"text":"taking them in My arms,","poem":2},{"text":"but they never realized","poem":1},{"text":"that it was I who healed them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It was I who taught Ephraim to walk, taking them in My arms, but they never realized that it was I who healed them.

contentJson: [{"text":"I led them with cords of kindness,","poem":1},{"text":"with ropes of love;","poem":2},{"text":"I lifted the yoke from their necks","poem":1},{"text":"and bent down to feed them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I led them with cords of kindness, with ropes of love; I lifted the yoke from their necks and bent down to feed them.

contentJson: [{"text":"Will they not return to the land of Egypt","poem":1},{"text":"and be ruled by Assyria","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"because they refused to repent?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Will they not return to the land of Egypt and be ruled by Assyria 
because they refused to repent?

contentJson: [{"text":"A sword will flash through their cities;","poem":1},{"text":"it will destroy the bars of their gates","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and consume them in their own plans.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
A sword will flash through their cities; it will destroy the bars of their gates 
and consume them in their own plans.

contentJson: [{"text":"My people are bent on turning from Me.","poem":1},{"text":"Though they call to the Most High,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"He will by no means exalt them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
My people are bent on turning from Me. Though they call to the Most High, 
He will by no means exalt them.

contentJson: [{"text":"How could I give you up, O Ephraim?","poem":1},{"text":"How could I surrender you, O Israel?","poem":2},{"text":"How could I make you like Admah?","poem":1},{"text":"How could I treat you like Zeboiim?","poem":2},{"text":"My heart is turned within Me;","poem":1},{"text":"My compassion is stirred!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: How could I give you up, O Ephraim? How could I surrender you, O Israel? How could I make you like Admah? How could I treat you like Zeboiim? My heart is turned within Me; My compassion is stirred!

contentJson: [{"text":"I will not execute the full fury of My anger;","poem":1},{"text":"I will not turn back to destroy Ephraim.","poem":2},{"text":"For I am God and not man—","poem":1},{"text":"the Holy One among you—","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and I will not come in wrath.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I will not execute the full fury of My anger; I will not turn back to destroy Ephraim. For I am God and not man— the Holy One among you— 
and I will not come in wrath.

contentJson: [{"text":"They will walk after the LORD;","poem":1},{"text":"He will roar like a lion.","poem":2},{"text":"When He roars,","poem":1},{"text":"His children will come trembling from the west.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They will walk after the LORD; He will roar like a lion. When He roars, His children will come trembling from the west.

contentJson: [{"text":"They will come trembling like birds from Egypt","poem":1},{"text":"and like doves from the land of Assyria.","poem":2},{"text":"Then I will settle them in their homes,","poem":1},{"text":"declares the LORD.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They will come trembling like birds from Egypt and like doves from the land of Assyria. Then I will settle them in their homes, declares the LORD.

contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim surrounds Me with lies,","poem":1},{"text":"the house of Israel with deceit;","poem":2},{"text":"but Judah still walks with God","poem":1},{"text":"and is faithful to the Holy One.","poem":2},{"noteId":56}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Ephraim surrounds Me with lies, the house of Israel with deceit; but Judah still walks with God and is faithful to the Holy One.

contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim","poem":1},{"noteId":57},{"text":"chases the wind","poem":1},{"text":"and pursues the east wind all day long;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"he multiplies lies and violence;","poem":2},{"text":"he makes a covenant with Assyria","poem":1},{"text":"and sends olive oil to Egypt.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Ephraim chases the wind and pursues the east wind all day long; 
he multiplies lies and violence; he makes a covenant with Assyria and sends olive oil to Egypt.

contentJson: [{"text":"The LORD also brings a charge against Judah.","poem":1},{"text":"He will punish Jacob","poem":2},{"noteId":58},{"text":"according to his ways","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and repay him according to his deeds.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The LORD also brings a charge against Judah. He will punish Jacob according to his ways 
and repay him according to his deeds.

contentJson: [{"text":"In the womb he grasped his brother’s heel,","poem":1},{"text":"and in his vigor he wrestled with God.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: In the womb he grasped his brother’s heel, and in his vigor he wrestled with God.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yes, he struggled with the angel","poem":1},{"noteId":59},{"text":"and prevailed;","poem":1},{"text":"he wept and sought His favor;","poem":2},{"text":"he found Him at Bethel","poem":1},{"text":"and spoke with Him there","poem":2},{"noteId":60},{"text":"—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yes, he struggled with the angel and prevailed; he wept and sought His favor; he found Him at Bethel and spoke with Him there —

contentJson: [{"text":"the LORD is the God of Hosts—","poem":1},{"text":"the LORD is His name of renown.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: the LORD is the God of Hosts— the LORD is His name of renown.

contentJson: [{"text":"But you must return to your God,","poem":1},{"text":"maintaining love and justice,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and always waiting on your God.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
But you must return to your God, maintaining love and justice, 
and always waiting on your God.

contentJson: [{"text":"A merchant loves to defraud","poem":1},{"text":"with dishonest scales in his hands.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: A merchant loves to defraud with dishonest scales in his hands.

contentJson: [{"text":"And Ephraim boasts: “How rich I have become!","poem":1},{"text":"I have found wealth for myself.","poem":2},{"text":"In all my labors, they can find in me","poem":1},{"text":"no iniquity that is sinful.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: And Ephraim boasts: “How rich I have become! I have found wealth for myself. In all my labors, they can find in me no iniquity that is sinful.”

contentJson: [{"text":"But I am the LORD your God","poem":1},{"text":"ever since the land of Egypt.","poem":2},{"text":"I will again make you dwell in tents,","poem":1},{"text":"as in the days of the appointed feast.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But I am the LORD your God ever since the land of Egypt. I will again make you dwell in tents, as in the days of the appointed feast.

contentJson: [{"text":"I spoke through the prophets","poem":1},{"text":"and multiplied their visions;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"I gave parables through the prophets.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I spoke through the prophets and multiplied their visions; 
I gave parables through the prophets.

contentJson: [{"text":"Is there iniquity in Gilead?","poem":1},{"text":"They will surely come to nothing.","poem":2},{"text":"Do they sacrifice bulls in Gilgal?","poem":1},{"text":"Indeed, their altars will be heaps of stones","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"in the furrows of the field.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Is there iniquity in Gilead? They will surely come to nothing. Do they sacrifice bulls in Gilgal? Indeed, their altars will be heaps of stones 
in the furrows of the field.

contentJson: [{"text":"Jacob fled to the land of Aram","poem":1},{"noteId":61},{"text":"and Israel worked for a wife—","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"for a wife he tended sheep.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Jacob fled to the land of Aram and Israel worked for a wife— 
for a wife he tended sheep.

contentJson: [{"text":"But by a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt,","poem":1},{"text":"and by a prophet he was preserved.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But by a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet he was preserved.

contentJson: [{"text":"Ephraim has provoked bitter anger,","poem":1},{"text":"so his Lord will leave his bloodguilt upon him","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and repay him for his contempt.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Ephraim has provoked bitter anger, so his Lord will leave his bloodguilt upon him 
and repay him for his contempt.

contentJson: [{"text":"When Ephraim","poem":1},{"noteId":62},{"text":"spoke, there was trembling;","poem":1},{"text":"he was exalted in Israel.","poem":2},{"text":"But he incurred guilt through Baal,","poem":1},{"text":"and he died.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling; he was exalted in Israel. But he incurred guilt through Baal, and he died.

contentJson: [{"text":"Now they sin more and more","poem":1},{"text":"and make for themselves cast images,","poem":2},{"text":"idols skillfully made from their silver,","poem":1},{"text":"all of them the work of craftsmen.","poem":2},{"text":"People say of them,","poem":1},{"text":"“They offer human sacrifice","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and kiss the calves!”","poem":2},{"noteId":63}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Now they sin more and more and make for themselves cast images, idols skillfully made from their silver, all of them the work of craftsmen. People say of them, “They offer human sacrifice 
and kiss the calves!”

contentJson: [{"text":"Therefore they will be like the morning mist,","poem":1},{"text":"like the early dew that vanishes,","poem":2},{"text":"like chaff blown from a threshing floor,","poem":1},{"text":"like smoke through an open window.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Therefore they will be like the morning mist, like the early dew that vanishes, like chaff blown from a threshing floor, like smoke through an open window.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet I am the LORD your God","poem":1},{"text":"ever since the land of Egypt;","poem":2},{"text":"you know no God but Me,","poem":1},{"text":"for there is no Savior besides Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet I am the LORD your God ever since the land of Egypt; you know no God but Me, for there is no Savior besides Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"I knew you in the wilderness,","poem":1},{"text":"in the land of drought.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I knew you in the wilderness, in the land of drought.

contentJson: [{"text":"When they had pasture,","poem":1},{"text":"they became satisfied;","poem":2},{"text":"when they were satisfied,","poem":1},{"text":"their hearts became proud,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and as a result they forgot Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
When they had pasture, they became satisfied; when they were satisfied, their hearts became proud, 
and as a result they forgot Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"So like a lion I will pounce on them;","poem":1},{"text":"like a leopard I will lurk by the path.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So like a lion I will pounce on them; like a leopard I will lurk by the path.

contentJson: [{"text":"Like a bear robbed of her cubs I will attack them,","poem":1},{"text":"and I will tear open their chests.","poem":2},{"text":"There I will devour them like a lion,","poem":1},{"text":"like a wild beast would tear them apart.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Like a bear robbed of her cubs I will attack them, and I will tear open their chests. There I will devour them like a lion, like a wild beast would tear them apart.

contentJson: [{"text":"You are destroyed, O Israel,","poem":1},{"text":"because you are against Me—","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"against your helper.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
You are destroyed, O Israel, because you are against Me— 
against your helper.

contentJson: [{"text":"Where is your king now","poem":1},{"noteId":64},{"text":"to save you in all your cities,","poem":2},{"text":"and the rulers to whom you said,","poem":1},{"text":"“Give me a king and princes”?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Where is your king now to save you in all your cities, and the rulers to whom you said, “Give me a king and princes”?

contentJson: [{"text":"So in My anger I gave you a king,","poem":1},{"text":"and in My wrath I took him away.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So in My anger I gave you a king, and in My wrath I took him away.

contentJson: [{"text":"The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up;","poem":1},{"text":"his sin is stored up.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; his sin is stored up.

contentJson: [{"text":"Labor pains come upon him,","poem":1},{"text":"but he is an unwise son.","poem":2},{"text":"When the time arrives,","poem":1},{"text":"he fails to present himself at the opening of the womb.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Labor pains come upon him, but he is an unwise son. When the time arrives, he fails to present himself at the opening of the womb.

contentJson: [{"text":"I will ransom them from the power of Sheol;","poem":1},{"text":"I will redeem them from Death.","poem":2},{"noteId":65},{"text":"Where, O Death, are your plagues?","poem":1},{"text":"Where, O Sheol, is your sting?","poem":2},{"noteId":66},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Compassion is hidden from My eyes.","poem":1}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I will ransom them from the power of Sheol; I will redeem them from Death. Where, O Death, are your plagues? Where, O Sheol, is your sting? 
Compassion is hidden from My eyes.

contentJson: [{"text":"Although he flourishes among his brothers,","poem":1},{"text":"an east wind will come—","poem":2},{"text":"a wind from the LORD","poem":1},{"text":"rising up from the desert.","poem":2},{"text":"His fountain will fail,","poem":1},{"text":"and his spring will run dry.","poem":2},{"text":"The wind will plunder his treasury","poem":1},{"text":"of every precious article.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Although he flourishes among his brothers, an east wind will come— a wind from the LORD rising up from the desert. His fountain will fail, and his spring will run dry. The wind will plunder his treasury of every precious article.

contentJson: [{"text":"Samaria will bear her guilt","poem":1},{"text":"because she has rebelled against her God.","poem":2},{"text":"They will fall by the sword;","poem":1},{"text":"their little ones will be dashed to pieces,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and their pregnant women ripped open.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Samaria will bear her guilt because she has rebelled against her God. They will fall by the sword; their little ones will be dashed to pieces, 
and their pregnant women ripped open.

contentJson: [{"text":"Return, O Israel, to the LORD your God,","poem":1},{"text":"for you have stumbled by your iniquity.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Return, O Israel, to the LORD your God, for you have stumbled by your iniquity.

contentJson: [{"text":"Bring your confessions","poem":1},{"text":"and return to the LORD.","poem":2},{"text":"Say to Him: “Take away all our iniquity","poem":1},{"text":"and receive us graciously,","poem":2},{"text":"that we may present","poem":1},{"text":"the fruit of our lips.","poem":2},{"noteId":67}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Bring your confessions and return to the LORD. Say to Him: “Take away all our iniquity and receive us graciously, that we may present the fruit of our lips.

contentJson: [{"text":"Assyria will not save us,","poem":1},{"text":"nor will we ride on horses.","poem":2},{"text":"We will never again say, ‘Our gods!’","poem":1},{"text":"to the work of our own hands.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"For in You the fatherless find compassion.”","poem":1}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Assyria will not save us, nor will we ride on horses. We will never again say, ‘Our gods!’ to the work of our own hands. 
For in You the fatherless find compassion.”

contentJson: [{"text":"I will heal their apostasy;","poem":1},{"text":"I will freely love them,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"for My anger has turned away from them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I will heal their apostasy; I will freely love them, 
for My anger has turned away from them.

contentJson: [{"text":"I will be like the dew to Israel;","poem":1},{"text":"he will blossom like the lily","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and take root like the cedars of Lebanon.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I will be like the dew to Israel; he will blossom like the lily 
and take root like the cedars of Lebanon.

contentJson: [{"text":"His shoots will sprout,","poem":1},{"text":"and his splendor will be like the olive tree,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"his fragrance like the cedars of Lebanon.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
His shoots will sprout, and his splendor will be like the olive tree, 
his fragrance like the cedars of Lebanon.

contentJson: [{"text":"They will return and dwell in his shade;","poem":1},{"text":"they will grow grain and blossom like the vine.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"His renown will be like the wine of Lebanon.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
They will return and dwell in his shade; they will grow grain and blossom like the vine. 
His renown will be like the wine of Lebanon.

contentJson: [{"text":"O Ephraim,","poem":1},{"noteId":68},{"text":"what have I to do","poem":1},{"text":"anymore with idols?","poem":2},{"text":"It is I who answer and watch over him.","poem":1},{"text":"I am like a flourishing cypress;","poem":2},{"noteId":69},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"your fruit comes from Me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
O Ephraim, what have I to do anymore with idols? It is I who answer and watch over him. I am like a flourishing cypress; 
your fruit comes from Me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Whoever is wise, let him understand these things;","poem":1},{"text":"whoever is discerning, let him know them.","poem":2},{"text":"For the ways of the LORD are right,","poem":1},{"text":"and the righteous walk in them","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"but the rebellious stumble in them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Whoever is wise, let him understand these things; whoever is discerning, let him know them. For the ways of the LORD are right, and the righteous walk in them 
but the rebellious stumble in them.
